column4: How do I tell an Ubuntu system to use a different version of gcc when compiling Ubuntu packages?

i believe /bin/gcc is a symbolic link to a specific version of gcc, though you SHOULD be building packages with pbuilder, in which case the debian directory tells what versions of utilities you'll be using

The problem I have is that though I've installed g++3.3 and g++ 3.4, there is no "g++" executible, and the version of gcc being used is 4.0.3.  I don't know how the system could be allowed to get into such a state, but it's a fresh install.
n/m - I seem to have found the problem.
